description: Dive into "Brighton Beach Bliss: Sun, Sand, and Serenity" â€” a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Brighton Beach Bliss: Sun, Sand, and Serenity

places.generalDescription: Hove Beach Huts are a vibrant and picturesque sight, reflecting the lively atmosphere of the city. These vintage-style huts come in a variety of colors and designs, making them perfect for photo shoots or as a backdrop for wedding adventures. They offer a delightful visual feast with their rainbow stripes, pastels, and bold patterns. Additionally, they are located near Brighton and provide an ideal setting for capturing memorable moments.

sources.snippet: The walk from Brighton to Hove takes a while (there is also a bus). We passed the i360 viewing tower and stopped at some cute shops (including one with two full walls of tea). The huts on Hove beach are colorful and iconic.
sources.shortName: Brighton, England

places.name: Hove Beach Huts

reviews.text: Spectacular views and nice walks. Check out the cafe at the farm

Beautiful beach front, one of my favourite places to come and chill with the Mrs, not so busy, can just take in the sun and views of the ocean in peace.
once you have soaked up all the sun and had all the swimms you can easily drive down to Brighton beach front as it's just a mile away for some dinner with many options from fish and chips to steak houses

After dinner A stroll on the peir in the evening to end a perfect day.
Brighton is still Brighton. Happy, relaxed atmosphere, with lots of fun thing6to do for all ages and still not too expensive too boot!

places.address: Hove Lawns, Kingsway, Brighton and Hove, Hove BN3 2PE, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton Beach, though covered in pebbles, is a popular spot for sunbathing and swimming during the English summer. The beachside promenade offers plenty to explore, making it an ideal place for a leisurely walk. Located on the west side of Brighton Palace Pier, this area boasts prominent attractions. A short one-hour train journey from London makes it a convenient escape for city dwellers seeking a day at the beach without traveling far.

sources.snippet: An obvious choice perhaps, but still an essential one to include: even more than Littlehampton, Brighton Beach is the place to go for those looking to do more with their day out than simply sunbathe. Of course it gets busy, especially during the summer, but there's a reason why: from the endless seafront fish and chip shops to the world-famous pier, there is never a dull moment in Brighton.
sources.shortName: The 10 best beaches within easy reach of Surrey to visit in May

sources.snippet: When my daughter was tiny, she spent hours stacking and arranging rocks and we didnâ€™t have sand in our car on the way home. The water is also cold, which doesnâ€™t stop some folks from surfing or swimming, but stops me from going past the ankles. If itâ€™s a nice day, paying a few pounds for a deck chair is well worth it.
sources.shortName: Brighton, England

sources.snippet: Brighton & Hove Beach: Stretching for 5 miles, this sandy paradise is the perfect place for a leisurely stroll and sunbathing sessions.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Brighton

places.name: Brighton Beach

reviews.text: Brighton Beach is one of my favourite places to spend time. The view of the sea is so wide and calming - just being there helps me relax and clear my mind. It's a perfect spot for a peaceful walk, sitting by the shore, or just enjoying the sound of the waves. The atmosphere is always nice, and it's a great escape from the busy city. Highly recommended for anyone who loves the sea and peaceful vibes.

The beach is a great place to sit and relax but wow, it's got so rough compared to a few years ago.
This isn't a place I'd spend more than a day at.
Lots of hen parties, drunks and quite a few homeless people. It was unnerving and I will not be visiting again in a hurry.
Much quieter/safer in Hove.

I really enjoy Brighton Beach and have visited multiple times. The beach itself is covered with pebbles, which I personally love. On this trip, I also had the chance to experience the Brighton i360, located right on the seafront. It's a great spot if you want panoramic views from above.
Unfortunately, the weather turned cloudy during our visit, so the views weren't as clear as I had hoped. Still, I think I prefer pebble beaches over sandy ones, which is why Brighton remains one of my favourites.

places.address: 4 Madeira Dr, Brighton, BN2 1ET, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Large shingle beach with rock & concrete groynes, access to the Undercliff Walk & a cafe.

sources.snippet: Just a hop, skip, and a jump from Ovingdean and Rottingdean beaches, Saltdean is the eastern-most coastal village to fall under the Brighton municipal umbrella. And it's a big beach, backed by a wide promenade, the Undercliff Walk, that connects it to Brighton some four miles away. Part of the same white-cliff coastline that stretches four miles west to Brighton, Saltdean Beach is, like its neighbors, predominantly pebble, although some sand is exposed at low tide.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Brighton, East Sussex

sources.snippet: Saltdean Beach: Located a few miles east of Brighton, this secluded sandy beach offers a peaceful retreat for nature enthusiasts.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Brighton

places.name: Saltdean Beach

reviews.text: Found this little beach by an accident. Loved it. Parking is limited however one can get a parking spot using a mobile app with a nearby houses. Very cheap. Recommend.

The beach was clean, there were toilets and a cafe. We saw a seal. The tide was in when we were there so all we saw was a shingle beach. Pleasant place to sit in the winter. Wheelchair friendly ramp onto the beach.
Nice family friendly beach with groynes to sit next to on windy days. Mainly pebbles but sandier as you get to the waterline. Parking , cafe and toilets are within a few hundred meters.

places.generalDescription: Brighton Naturist Beach, the first place in Britain to allow naked bathing, initially sparked controversy among locals. Some argued that it would attract unwanted attention and be offensive. The area is clean and suitable for skinny dipping, with nearby parking available. However, the beach is visible from the seafront buildings. Signposted as LGBT+ friendly, it offers a relaxed atmosphere and clear waters for swimming.

sources.snippet: In 1980, controversy surrounded the opening of Brighton's 200-yard 'naturist' section of beach. Critics claimed it would only attract perverts and voyeurs. Instead, as hoped by the local council, it brought a more liberal attitude to the city, and is one of the most popular naturist beaches in Britain today.
sources.shortName: Brighton Closest Beaches | East Sussex Seaside Towns

places.name: Brighton Naturist Beach

reviews.text: Going here was not really planned but hey ho, I was passing and decided to give it a go. The area is clearly marked out as a naturist beach and you can plonk yourself anywhere you like. I was fortunate to have a really nice day with very little breeze and I felt comfortable stripping down and basking in the sunshine. The beach is pebbles, as with most beaches in Brighton, so definitely take a towel with you as I certainly will when I next return. Everyone there was just happy enjoying the sunshine and freedom, and no one bothered me as I lay there. If you go just be confident and strip off as you will see all shapes and sizes. Not recommended on a chilly day though ðŸ¤­

A bit cold but beautiful sunshine and calm sea. Quite a few guys went in the water for a swim. Lovely beach.
Happy memories. Now gone. The beach here is now no longer available. It has become part of the "modernization" where you can only walk on set paths through non existent plants.
This area is no longer natural in any way.
And so it goes.....
A pool for only the very privaliged
No normal resident can access it.
Just another " private use"  area paid for by Brighton citizens who have no access to it..

In my person experience I felt very safe as a single woman, went for it and even had a swim. Beach wasn't too packed but I didn't have any issues with creeps or unwanted interactions, would definitely go back.

places.address: 106 Chichester Terrace, Brighton, BN2 1EN, United Kingdom

sources.snippet: Even if you don't take the opportunity for a swim at Ovingdean Beach, it's well worth a visit. A scenic one-mile stroll from Brighton Marina along Undercliff Walk, this usually quiet pebble beach is perfect for those wanting to be close enough to Brighton to enjoy the many fun things to do here, but far enough away to avoid the crowds. Set at the base of a stunning row of white chalk cliffs, the clear, clean waters are perfect for swimming at low or high tide.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Brighton, East Sussex

sources.snippet: Ovingdean beach is a pebbly beach, with some sand at low tide, to the East of Brighton. When the tide is out the kids love to play, and discover the wildlife, in the rockpools. Access to the beach is down several steps, so it can be quite tricky with very young kids and lots of baggage in tow.
sources.shortName: Kids in Brighton  | Beaches in Brighton
Best Beaches in Brighton

places.name: Ovingdean Beach

reviews.text: Nice place to sit down and relax while doing the Undercliff Walk.

Well he loved it here for sure! We had the whole "beach" to ourselves as there is no sand. Just very pebbley. Flip flops not the best footwear for this. Enjoyed the whole place to ourselves though. And he got to run and explore
Mostly sandy little bits of beach, the dogs loved it

places.address: Marine Dr, Brighton, BN2 7HG, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Rottingdean Beach is a low-key stretch of shoreline with pebbly sand and a paved promenade, offering parking and a cafe. The town center has an old-timey atmosphere with cobbled streets, providing a nice change from Brighton. Just a short 15-minute drive away, this beach gives off the feeling of being in the quiet countryside. Mollys At The Beach is an independent coffee shop that serves their famous millionaire hot chocolates.

sources.snippet: Head another mile farther along Undercliff Walk eastward from Brighton (a total of two miles), and you'll find yourself on Rottingdean Beach. You can also get to the beach by bus or car and then access the beach from the village high street. There's plenty of street parking available along with a dedicated clifftop parking lot.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Brighton, East Sussex

sources.snippet: Situated to the East of Brighton, Rottingdean is a pebbly beach backed by high chalk cliffs, which is ideal for rockpooling when the tide is out. It is a short walk from Rottingdean village which has pubs, tea rooms and shops. A take-away fish and chip shop is a couple of minutes walk from the beach.
sources.shortName: Kids in Brighton  | Beaches in Brighton

sources.snippet: Activities & Attractions: Visitors can indulge in water sports, beach volleyball, and visit nearby attractions like the Brighton Palace Pier, British Airways i360, and the Royal Pavilion.
sources.shortName: Discover Brighton Beaches: A Year-Round Coastal Escape Full of Culture and Adventure
Best Beaches in Brighton

places.name: Rottingdean Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful sunset spot. Best option is to cycle down the undercliff road. You can hire berry cycles from the beach. Just download the berry app and look for available cycles. Toilets also nearby.

Beautiful and peaceful spot right by the coast. Rottingdean Beach is perfect for cycling, running, or skating-just keep in mind the pavement can be a little rough in some areas. There's paid parking within walking distance, which makes access easy enough, especially on nice days.

One of the highlights is the little coffee shop (Peavey) just down the path near the beach-great for grabbing a hot drink or snack while enjoying the view. If you're hungry, there are several pubs and local shops nearby, giving you plenty of food options even if you didn't pack anything.

There's even a public shower you can use to rinse off before heading home, which is super convenient. Overall, it's a lovely spot to relax, get active, or just enjoy the sea breeze. Highly recommend it!

Lovely place to spend the day. The beach is mainly pebbles though. There are a couple of nearby car parks, a cafe situated on site, a few shops selling beach wares and a pub, that is currently renovation.

sources.snippet: Located an easy 15-minute walk east of Brighton Palace Pier and directly opposite the neighborhood after which it's named, Kemptown Beach extends as far as Brighton Marina and is popular among those who enjoy a less crowded beach experience. Not that the beach doesn't get busyâ€“it does, but it tends to draw a more adult crowd than the family-oriented main beach. In addition to sunbathers catching the rays on the mostly shingle beach (some sand is revealed at low tide), Kemptown Beach is popular for activities such as windsurfing, surfing, paddleboarding, and kayaking.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Brighton, East Sussex

places.name: Brighton Central Beach

reviews.text: Brighton beach was calm and relaxing, clean - different than the usual sand beaches I visited. First time visiting a pebble beach. Our group spent about 4 hours from sunrise to 9AM. Definitely recommend it.
Relaxing place to go with family and friends...had lots of fun
We didn't go at the right time there was a festival but I think normally it would be wonderful

places.address: Madeira Dr, Brighton, BN2 1ET, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: When visiting Brighton, families will find a welcoming atmosphere at the Black Rock Public Toilets, which are designed with convenience in mind. Located near family-friendly beaches, these facilities ensure that parents and children can enjoy their seaside adventures without worry. With safety measures in place and amenities tailored for comfort, the Black Rock Public Toilets contribute to a stress-free beach day experience.

sources.snippet: Brighton is an excellent destination for families, with a range of beaches that cater specifically to their needs. Safety measures and amenities are carefully suited to ensure a stress-free beach experience for both parents and children. Let's explore the family-friendly beaches in Brighton and the facilities they offer.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Brighton

places.name: Black Rock Public Toilets

reviews.text: As you'd expect for sea side toilets

It's a real shame that the public loos at Black Rock are not maintained to a satisfactory standard. They were closed for months at the end of 2024 and are still closed going into 2025. It's not really a big ask of the council considering all the money spent redeveloping the Black Rock area, which is brillant. The boardwalk is first class and allows disabled people much better access. However, if you need the loo and finding them closed with a notice saying the next nearest one is 700-800  metres away is no joke. Please get this sorted out Brighton Council.
Closed all the Summer of 2024, likely because they were rancid, flooded and unattended with no water pressure. (There are public toilets on the Marina - by the steps toward asdas)

places.address: Madeira Dr, Brighton Marina, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN2 1FY, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Hove Beach, located about a mile west of the pier, offers a different atmosphere compared to Brighton Central Beach. The wide esplanade and cycle path along with Hove Lawns provide a contrast to the built-up seafront near the pier. This shingle shoreline is perfect for those seeking a quieter and more relaxed beach experience.

sources.snippet: Located around a mile west of the pier, the community of Hove has grown to such an extent that it now lends itself to Brighton's official name: Brighton and Hove. Despite this, Hove Beach has a quite different feel to Brighton Central Beach. Backed by a wide section of esplanade, a cycle path, and the pleasant Hove Lawns, a green space that's a contrast to the built-up seafront nearer the pier, the beach here is a continuation of the shingle shoreline that extends along this section of East Sussex coastline.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Brighton, East Sussex

sources.snippet: You might want to book places close to the best of Hoveâ€™s beach scene. A wonderful alternative to the bustling Brighton Beach, Hove Beach is a quieter yet still popular zone where you and your dogs can go ahead and enjoy the shingle straits. Once again, the block on dogs walking on the sand between May and September extends here, too.
sources.shortName: The Best Dog Friendly Beaches in Brighton

sources.snippet: Hove's well known beach is mostly shingle and runs adjacent to the centre of the town, which is part of the Brighton and Hove metropolis - apparently one of the sunniest places in the country. The beach is interspersed by regular groynes and backed by a long esplanade with a cycle lane, as well as Hoveâ€¦
sources.shortName: Hove Closest Beaches | East Sussex Seaside Towns

sources.snippet: If you travel West of Brighton Beach you will come to Hove beach. It is usually less crowded than Brighton but still has plenty of amenities. Hove also benefits from having Hove Lawns, a large area suitable for playing games and having picnics.
sources.shortName: Kids in Brighton  | Beaches in Brighton

sources.snippet: Activities & Attractions: Visitors can indulge in water sports, beach volleyball, and visit nearby attractions like the Brighton Palace Pier, British Airways i360, and the Royal Pavilion.
sources.shortName: Discover Brighton Beaches: A Year-Round Coastal Escape Full of Culture and Adventure

places.name: Hove Beach

reviews.text: Love Hove and walking down the beach, especially out of season. Only one complaint why can't the council clear the stones off the pathways, stairs regularly & not just when their is an event going on.

This beach is very simlar to Brighton beach but not quite as good. I dont think they named a book after it . Actually, @I think the book I am thinking about is Brighton Rock. Same comments as Brighton beach, not enough sand and the temperature of the sea is way too low and the water is somewhat murky. There are much better beaches in warmer countries.
Really peaceful beach beside those gorgeous big white crescent houses that face the sea.

places.address: 266 Adelaide Cres, Brighton and Hove, Hove BN3 2JJ, United Kingdom
